title: OSX: sudo.sh script need to test if /usr/local/bin exist or not, if not create one.
body:
Before filing a bug, please check whether it has been fixed since
the latest release: run "hg pull", "hg update default", rebuild, and
retry
what you did to
reproduce the problem.  Thanks.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. go/src/.sudo.bash

What is the expected output?

no error

What do you see instead?
Ryan-Yangs-iMac:src tjyang$ ./sudo.bash
Password:
cp: /usr/local/bin/6prof: No such file or directory
Ryan-Yangs-iMac:src tjyang$ more ./sudo.bash


Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?

6g version release.r59 9022

Which operating system are you using?
 System Version: Mac OS X 10.6.8 (10K549)

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)

d5785050f61d (release-branch.r59) release/release.r59

Please provide any additional information below.
sudo.sh script need to test if /usr/local/bin exist or not, if not create one.
